definition: (chemistry) The formation of a powdery surface on crystals, as a hydrate is converted to anhydrous form by losing loosely bound water of crystallization to the atmosphere.

example: Ancient literature frequently mentions the curative and restorative powers of this balm , essentially in connection with the healing of wounds.
